title: Calculator: Apple Weights
question_text:
The distribution of weights of apples at a local supermarket is normally distributed with a mean of $0.75\text{ lbs}$ and standard deviation of $0.12\text{ lbs}$.

solution:
If $98\%$ of samples are over a certain weight, look in the standard normal table for the $2^\text{nd}\text{ percentile}$.

The $Z$-score for the $2^\text{nd}\text{ percentile}$ is between $-2.05$ and $-2.06$. Students can choose either one or split the difference at $-2.055$.
